p:
Baloxavir has a novel mechanism of action, preventing the formation of new virions by blocking replication early in the influenza life cycle.
16, 17 Two previous Japanese studies evaluating the use of baloxavir in children <12 years old have been completed; however, both were small, open-label studies (JapicCTI-163417
24 and JapicCTI-173811). MiniSTONE-2 is the first global, phase III, randomized active controlled study designed to investigate the safety and efficacy of a single dose of baloxavir in children.
